info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 23 at 3:22PM PST until December 24 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM FRIDAY TO 10 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory through tonight, additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. For the second Winter Weather Advisory Friday afternoon into Saturday morning, snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches expected. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...In Modoc County, California, portions of Highway 139 between Tionesta and Adin, portions of Highway 299 between Alturas and Cedar Pass, and Highway 395 north of Alturas. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 AM PST Friday. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 PM Friday to 10 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Two rounds of snowfall are expected through Saturday morning. The first will be this morning. The second is expected mainly this evening through early Friday morning. Additional snow is expected late Saturday into Monday. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
